title: ICE when passing slice with const eval length to method

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: A-associated-items
labels.description: Area: Associated items such as associated types and consts.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
I tried this code:
```
struct Foo<'a> {
    data: &'a [u8],
}

impl<'a> Foo<'a> {
    const LEN: usize = 4;
    fn bar(buf: &mut [u8; Self::LEN]) {
        unimplemented!()
    }
}
```
I expected a successful compile, however rustc panicked.
Without the lifetime annotation (only `struct Foo;`) the panic does not happen and it compiles successfully.

## Meta
rust version: rustc 1.28.0 (9634041f0 2018-07-30) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

playground link: https://play.rust-lang.org/?gist=4f897c3fc9de85f853b16cc0a8c2b562&version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2015

Backtrace:
```
   Compiling playground v0.0.1 (file:///playground)
thread 'main' panicked at 'assertion failed: `(left == right)`
  left: `Some(NodeId(13))`,
 right: `None`: free_scope: DefId(0/0:4 ~ playground[a256]::{{impl}}[0]) not recognized by the region scope tree for None / Some(DefId(0/0:6 ~ playground[a256]::{{impl}}[0]::bar[0]))', librustc/middle/region.rs:734:13

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.28.0 (9634041f0 2018-07-30) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

note: compiler flags: -C codegen-units=1 -C debuginfo=2 --crate-type lib

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

error: Could not compile `playground`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```
